title: Process Control Block (PCB)
subject: Operating Systems
theory:
Data structure in Kernel used to track a process. Contains:
- Process ID (PID)
- State (Ready/Run)
- CPU Registers (PC, SP) saved when swapping out.
- Open files list.

interview_questions.question: What happens during a Context Switch?
interview_questions.answer: OS saves current PCB (registers, state) and loads the PCB of the next process. It is pure overhead.

exam_notes: PCB is stored in Kernel Stack/Memory.
